{"step_by_step_thinking": "Scammon's growth curve describes the growth patterns of different tissues in the human body. According to this curve, neural tissues indeed complete most of their growth by 6 years of age, so option A is true. Lymphoid tissues reach their maximum growth at around 200% by the age of 12-14 years and then regress, so option B is also true. Genital tissues undergo most of their growth during puberty, so option C is true as well. Therefore, all the given options are true, which means the false statement is that none of the above are false.", "answer_choice": "D"}
